content: # # National FlagDurationUseDescription1959 –[Flag of Singapore](/wiki/Flag_of_Singapore)A horizontal bicolour of red over white, charged in white in the canton with a crescent facing, towards the fly, a pentagon of five stars. ## Government FlagDurationUseDescription1960 –Presidential standardUsed to denote the presence of the [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore) while in the country.1960 –State marine ensignUsed by non-military, government vessels. Referred colloquially to as the Blue Ensign.1966 –[Civil ensign](/wiki/Civil_ensign)Used by Singapore-registered civilian ships. Referred to in law as the [Red Ensign](/wiki/Red_Ensign_of_Singapore). ## Military FlagDurationUseDescription1965 –Flag of the [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces)State flag with the emblem of the [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces) on the lower right.1965 –Service flag of the [Singapore Army](/wiki/Singapore_Army)Crescent and stars in a red field on the top left, with the remaining 3/4 of the flag in yellow, and the emblem of the Singapore Armed Forces on the lower right.1965 -Colour of the Singapore ArmySame flag of Singapore Army without emblem1990 –Service flag of the [Republic of Singapore Air Force](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force)Crescent and stars in a red field on the top left, with the remaining 3/4 of the flag in blue, and the [Lion Head symbol](/wiki/Lion_head_symbol_of_Singapore) on the lower right.1990 -Colour of the Republic of Singapore Air Force Same flag of Republic of Singapore Air Force without emblem 1967 –Service flag and [naval ensign](/wiki/Naval_ensign) of the [Republic of Singapore Navy](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Navy)Crescent and stars in a red field on the top left, with the remaining 3/4 of the flag in white, and the mariner's [compass rose](/wiki/Compass_rose) on the lower right. The naval ensign is mandated to be of a 1:2 ratio (top) as set out in the Misc.1 of 1967 legislation passed in the Parliament of Singapore. However, a 2:3 variant is used today (bottom).1965 –[Commissioning pennant](/wiki/Pennant_(commissioning))Triangular pennant with the crescent and stars on the far left; flown at the highest mast of commissioned naval ships at all times.2022 –Service flag of the [Digital and Intelligence Service](/wiki/Digital_and_Intelligence_Service)Crescent and stars in a red field on the top left, with the remaining 3/4 of the flag in dark grey, and the DIS logo on the lower right.2022 –Colour of the Digital Intelligence ServiceSame flag as DIS without the crest ## Miscellaneous FlagDurationUseDescription1929–2021Malaysia Preventive Service flagTo be used by Malaysian owned ships when operating in Singaporean waters Repealed on 1 March 2021. ## Historic FlagDurationUseDescription1025–1070[Chola dynasty](/wiki/Chola_dynasty)A red swallowtailed field with a [tiger](/wiki/Tiger) in the center.1398–1400[Majapahit](/wiki/Majapahit)13 horizontal stripes alternating red and white.1614–1636[Aceh Sultanate](/wiki/Aceh_Sultanate)A Red Banner with a white crescent moon and a 5 pointed star. a sword is below them.1636–1819[Johor Sultanate](/wiki/Johor_Sultanate)A simple white banner.1819–1868[British East India Company](/wiki/East_India_Company)A striped banner with the [Union Jack](/wiki/Union_Jack) in the canton.1868–1877[Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements)This article or section **is undergoing significant expansion or restructuring.** You are welcome to assist in its construction by editing it as well. If this article or section has not been edited in several days, please remove this template. *If you are actively editing this article or section, you can replace this template with `{{in use|5 minutes}}`.* This article was last edited by RAPTOR7762 (talk | contribs) 32 hours ago. *(Update timer)*1877–1904[Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements)Officially adopted in 1877 when Singapore was joined with Malacca and Penang as a single Crown colony.1904–1925[Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements)similar to the previous flag, with different crowns.1925–1942 1945–1946[Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements)similar to the previous flag, without the white disc.1942–1945[Flag of Japan](/wiki/Flag_of_Japan)Used during the [Japanese occupation of Singapore](/wiki/Japanese_occupation_of_Singapore). The actual flag is still used in Japan as the national flag (officially since 1999 after some modifications).1946–1952[Crown colony of Singapore](/wiki/Post-war_Singapore)Adopted when Singapore became a Crown colony on its own following the dissolution of the Crown colony of the Straits Settlements.1952–1959[Crown colony of Singapore](/wiki/Post-war_Singapore)Modification from the previous flag; this version has a slightly modified crown.1963–1965[Flag of Malaysia](/wiki/Flag_of_Malaysia)Used in Singapore during the [statehood in Malaysia](/wiki/Singapore_in_Malaysia). Still the current flag of Malaysia. - [Armorial of Singapore](/wiki/Armorial_of_Singapore) - [Majulah Singapura](/wiki/Majulah_Singapura)
title: List of Singaporean flags
